allSaves.value: +1 status to all saves vs. magic, +2 status to all saves vs. mental

details.publicNotes: Drow fighters train to master techniques that inflict deep, bleeding wounds and use poisoned crossbow bolts to exhaust enemies.

description.value:
You create a shroud of darkness that prevents light from penetrating or emanating within the area. Light does not enter the area and any non-magical light sources, such as a torch or lantern, do not emanate any light while inside the area, even if their light radius would extend beyond the darkness. This also suppresses magical light of your darkness spell's level or lower. Light can't pass through, so creatures in the area can't see outside. From outside, it appears as a globe of pure darkness.

Heightened Even creatures with darkvision (but not greater darkvision) can barely see through the darkness. They treat targets seen through the darkness as @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.Concealed]{Concealed}.

All creatures in the area when you cast the spell are limned in colorful, heatless fire of a color of your choice for the duration. Visible creatures can't be @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.Concealed]{Concealed} while affected by faerie fire. If the creatures are @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.Invisible]{Invisible}, they are @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.Concealed]{Concealed} while affected by faerie fire, rather than being @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.Undetected]{Undetected}.

You create up to four floating lights, no two of which are more than 10 feet apart. Each sheds light like a torch. When you Sustain the Spell, you can move any number of lights up to 60 feet. Each light must remain within 120 feet of you and within 10 feet of all others, or it winks out.

Sometimes referred to as an alley bow by rogues or ruffians, this small crossbow fires small bolts that are sometimes used to deliver poison to the target. It's small enough to be shot one-handed, but it still requires two hands to load.
A mix of flexible and molded boiled leather, a suit of this type of armor provides some protection with maximum flexibility.

Lethargy poison is commonly used in hit-and-run tactics by drow and others who want their victims alive; the ambusher retreats until the poison sets in and the victim falls unconscious. Further exposure to lethargy poison does not require the target to attempt additional saving throws; only failing an saving throw against an ongoing exposure can progress its stage.

Activate D Interact (Injury)

Saving Throw Fortitude

Maximum Duration 4 hours

Stage 1 @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.Slowed]{Slowed 1} (1 round)

Stage 2 slowed 1 (1 minute)

Stage 3 @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.Unconscious]{Unconscious} with no Perception check to wake up (1 round)

Stage 4 unconscious with no Perception check to wake up ([[/br 1d4 #hours]]{1d4 hours}).
Shorter than traditional arrows but similar in construction, bolts are the ammunition used by crossbows.

items.name: +1 Status to All Saves vs Magic
+2 Status to All Saves vs Mental

description.value: The drow fighter draws a weapon using the @Compendium[pf2e.actionspf2e.Interact]{Interact} action, then Strikes with that weapon.

The drow fighter Strikes with its rapier, and gains a +1 circumstance bonus to the attack roll. A creature damaged by the attack takes [[/r 1d6 #persistent bleed]] @Compendium[pf2e.conditionitems.Persistent Damage]{Persistent Bleed Damage}.
